org.apache.freemarker.core.templateresolver

Interface TemplateLoaderSession


  • public interface TemplateLoaderSession
    Stores shared state between TemplateLoader operations that are executed close to each other in the same thread. For example, a TemplateLoader that reads from a database might wants to store the database connection in it for reuse. The goal of sessions is mostly to increase performance. However, because a DefaultTemplateResolver.getTemplate(String, java.util.Locale, Object, String, boolean) call is executed inside a single session, sessions can be also be utilized to ensure that the template lookup (see TemplateLookupStrategy) happens on a consistent view (a snapshot) of the backing storage, if the backing storage mechanism supports such thing.

    The TemplateLoaderSession implementation is (usually) specific to the TemplateLoader implementation. If your TemplateLoader implementation can't take advantage of sessions, you don't have to implement this interface, just return null for TemplateLoader.createSession().

    TemplateLoaderSession-s should be lazy, that is, creating an instance should be very fast and should not cause I/O. Only when (and if ever) the shared resource stored in the session is needed for the first time should the shared resource be initialized.

    TemplateLoaderSession-s need not be thread safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this session, freeing any resources it holds.
      boolean isClosed()
      Tells if this session is closed.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Closes this session, freeing any resources it holds. Further operations involving this session should fail, with the exception of close() itself, which should be silently ignored.

        The Reader or InputStream contained in the TemplateLoadingResult must be closed before close() is called on the session in which the TemplateLoadingResult was created. Except, if closing the Reader or InputStream has thrown an exception, the caller should just proceed with closing the session regardless. After close() was called on the session, the methods of the Reader or InputStream is allowed to throw an exception, or behave in any other erratic way. (Because the caller of this interface is usually FreeMarker (the DefaultTemplateResolver), normally you don't have to deal with these rules, but it's useful to know the expectations if you implement TemplateLoaderSession.)

        The caller of TemplateLoader.createSession() has to guarantee that close() will be called on the created session.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Tells if this session is closed.
